task.title: Creating a Cluster Configuration
task.shortdesc: As you configure a Pivotal GemFire cluster using gfsh commands, gfsh saves a set of shared configuration files that you can use to start additional servers or to export the configurations for use in another cluster.

context.p: The following high-level steps create a basic Pivotal GemFire cluster. As you issue the gfsh commands to configure your cluster, the Cluster Configuration Service creates and saves the shared configurations to the locator directory. The configuration is replicated to all locators in the cluster.

step.cmd: Create regions, gateways, queues, disk stores, and other Pivotal GemFire objects as required for your Pivotal GemFire cluster.
step.info: See . For example, the following command creates a PARTITION region: gfsh>create region --name=regionA --type=PARTITION Member | Status ------- | -------------------------------------- server1 | Region "/regionA" created on "server1"

step.cmd: Deploy jar files. Use the gfsh deploy command to deploy application jar files to all members or to a specified group of members. For example:

info.codeblock: gfsh>deploy --jar=../lib/myApp.jar Member | Deployed JAR | Deployed JAR Location ------- | ------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------ server1 | myApp.jar | /home/erawlings/gf80/jul9/startup2/server1/vf.gf#myApp.jar#1
